and get back to work, and we will build a better future, for our children, and our children‚Äôs children, here on Long Island. 

I am overwhelmed by the amazing volunteers and supporters who have been with me throughout this campaign.

This campaign showed me the incredible resilience of Suffolk County, and I know that together we will get through the challenges that we face. We will overcome this deadly pandemic, we will make sure every person gets the healthcare they need, we will safely re-open the economy

Despite our loss, I am so honored to have received more votes than any Democratic candidate ever has in New York‚Äôs 1st District. Your tireless efforts and the hard work of our campaign, our volunteers and our dedicated supporters are what made that possible.

Our campaign has always been rooted in science. Science follows the evidence and faces the facts, even when it‚Äôs not what we want to hear. It has been such a privilege to run this race, but after seeing the results of the absentee vote counts, we still came up short.

Our #Veterans have fought to protect our way of life. Let‚Äôs¬†honor and celebrate our veterans by standing up for our Democracy, ensuring that our voices are heard, and that every vote, in Suffolk and across the country, is counted.¬†Thank you to all who have served our country!
While we continue waiting for the remainder of our ballots to be counted, I am full of hope that we will come together and move forward as a country.
